009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D50;
013import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D65;
014
015import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
016
017import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.BradfordAdaptation;
018import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.ChromaticAdaptation;
019import imagingbook.common.color.gamma.ModifiedGammaMapping;
020import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
021
022
023/**
024 * <p>
025 * This class implements the sRGBcolor space with D65 white point. See Sec. 14.4
026 * of [1] for details. Components of all {@code float[]} colors are supposed to
027 * be in [0,1]. This is a singleton class with no public constructors, use
028 * {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
029 * </p>
030 * <p>
031 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
032 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
033 * </p>
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2022/11/14
037 * @see LinearRgb65ColorSpace
038 */
039@SuppressWarnings("serial")
040public class sRgbColorSpace extends ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion, RgbReferenceData {
041        
042        // chromatic adaptation objects:
043        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D65, D50);
044        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50, D65);
045        private static final ModifiedGammaMapping GammaMap = ModifiedGammaMapping.sRGB;
046        
047        private static final sRgbColorSpace instance = new sRgbColorSpace();
048        
049        public static sRgbColorSpace getInstance() {
050                return instance;
051        }
052        
053        /** Matrix for conversion from XYZ to linear RGB. Its column vectors are the 
054         * XYZ coordinates of the RGB primaries. */
055        private static final double[][] Mrgbi = 
056                {{0.412453, 0.357580, 0.180423},
057                 {0.212671, 0.715160, 0.072169},
058                 {0.019334, 0.119193, 0.950227}};
059        private static final float[][] MrgbiF = Matrix.toFloat(Mrgbi);
060        
061        /** Matrix for conversion from linear RGB to XYZ (inverse of {@link #Mrgbi}). */
062        private static final double[][] Mrgb = Matrix.inverse(Mrgbi);
063        private static final float[][] MrgbF = Matrix.toFloat(Mrgb);
064        
065        // ----------------------------------------------------
066        
067        @Override
068        public float[] getWhitePoint() {
069                return Matrix.toFloat(D65.getXYZ());
070        }
071        
072        @Override
073        public float[] getPrimary(int idx) {
074                return Matrix.toFloat(Matrix.getColumn(Mrgbi, idx));
075        }
076        
077        // ----------------------------------------------------
078        
079        /** Constructor (not public). */
080        private sRgbColorSpace() {
081                super(ColorSpace.TYPE_RGB, 3);
082        }
083        
084        // direct conversion from/to D65-based XYZ space ------------------------------
085        
086        @Override
087        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] xyz65) {
088                float[] rgb = Matrix.multiply(MrgbF, xyz65);    // to linear RGB
089                return GammaMap.applyFwd(rgb);                                  // to non-linear sRGB
090        }
091        
092        @Override
093        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] srgbTHIS) {
094                float[] rgb = GammaMap.applyInv(srgbTHIS);              // to linear rgb
095                return Matrix.multiply(MrgbiF, rgb);    // to XYZ (D65)
096        }
097        
098        // Methods required by ColorSpace (conversion from/to PCS space) ------------------
099
100        // assumes xyz50 is in D50-based CS_CIEXYZ color space
101        @Override
102        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] xyz50PCS) {
103                float[] xyz65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(xyz50PCS);  // to XYZ (D65)
104                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(xyz65);                                // to sRGB
105        }
106
107        // returned colors are in D50-based CS_CIEXYZ color space 
108        @Override
109        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] srgbTHIS) {
110                float[] xyz65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(srgbTHIS);              // to XYZ (D65)
111                return catD65toD50.applyTo(xyz65);              // to XYZ (D50)
112        }
113        
114        // ----------------------------------------------------
115        
116        @Override // no conversion needed, since this is sRGB
117        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
118                return srgb;
119        }
120
121        @Override // no conversion needed, since this is sRGB
122        public float[] toRGB(float[] srgbTHIS) {
123                return srgbTHIS;
124        }
125
126}
